# **Personal Website Workshop**

## **Event Details**

- **Date:** April 02, 2025
- **Time:** 4:00 PM â€“ 6:00 PM
- **Location:** Alden Hall, Room 101
- **Instructor:** Alish Chhetri

## **Workshop Purpose**

This workshop is designed to help participants create and publish a simple personal website using basic HTML and CSS, with optional JavaScript. The goal is to introduce core web development concepts in a clear, beginner-friendly format, and help attendees get their site live by the end of the session.

Slides: [Workshop Slides](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1fNOEq5sTVyJYYQz9q6vDxKX2aCDGY8SY19cbWqQSqn4/edit?usp=sharing)

## **What Will Be Covered**

### **Introduction to HTML**
Understanding the structure of a webpage and learning how to add text, links, images, and sections.

### **Basic CSS Styling**
How to style the page with colors, fonts, layout techniques, and simple visual adjustments.

### **Hosting with Netlify**
How to upload the finished website to Netlify using the drag-and-drop method, and make it publicly accessible. We'll also cover basic updates and custom domain setup.

## **Requirements for Participants**

- Visual Studio Code (code editor)
- No prior coding experience is required

## **Expected Outcomes**

By the end of the workshop, participants will:

- Understand the basics of how websites are built and styled
- Create a simple personal site with their own content
- Successfully publish their site using Netlify
- Gain confidence to continue learning and expanding their site

## **Pre-Workshop Setup**

Please install the following software before attending the workshop to ensure a smooth experience:

### **Required Software**

#### **Visual Studio Code (VSCode)**

##### **Windows**

1. Download the installer from the [official VSCode website](https://code.visualstudio.com/).
2. Run the installer and follow the prompts.
3. Install recommended extensions:
   - Open VSCode, go to the **Extensions** view (`Ctrl+Shift+X`), and search for the following:
     - "Live Server"
     - "Intellicode"
     - "Intellicode API Usage Examples"
   - Click **"Install"** for each.

##### **Linux (Ubuntu)**

1. Download the latest `.deb` package from the [official VSCode website](https://code.visualstudio.com/Download).
2. Install the `.deb` package using **Terminal**:
   ```
   sudo dpkg -i code_*.deb
   sudo apt-get install -f
   ```
3. Install recommended extensions as described above.

##### **macOS**

1. Download the installer from the [official VSCode website](https://code.visualstudio.com/).
2. Open the downloaded file and drag the VSCode icon into the **Applications** folder.
3. Install recommended extensions as described above.

#### **Git and GitHub**

##### **Windows**

1. Download Git from [git-scm.com](https://git-scm.com/download/win).
2. Run the installer, accepting the default options (you can customize if you're familiar with Git).
3. Create a GitHub account at [github.com](https://github.com/signup) if you don't have one.
4. Configure Git with your name and email:
   ```
   git config --global user.name "Your Name"
   git config --global user.email "your.email@example.com"
   ```

##### **Linux (Ubuntu)**

1. Install Git using Terminal:
   ```
   sudo apt update
   sudo apt install git
   ```
2. Create a GitHub account at [github.com](https://github.com/signup) if you don't have one.
3. Configure Git with your name and email as shown above.

##### **macOS**

1. Install Git using one of these methods:
   - Using Homebrew (if installed): `brew install git`
   - Download from [git-scm.com](https://git-scm.com/download/mac)
2. Create a GitHub account at [github.com](https://github.com/signup) if you don't have one.
3. Configure Git with your name and email as shown above.

### **Optional Software (for Quarto approach)**

#### **Quarto**

##### **Windows**

1. Download the installer from the [Quarto website](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/).
2. Run the installer and follow the prompts.
3. Verify installation by opening Command Prompt and typing:
   ```
   quarto --version
   ```

##### **Linux**

1. Download the Linux package from the [Quarto website](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/).
2. Extract and install:
   ```
   sudo dpkg -i quarto-*.deb
   ```
3. Verify with `quarto --version`.

##### **macOS**

1. Download the macOS installer from the [Quarto website](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/).
2. Open the downloaded file and follow installation instructions.
3. Verify with `quarto --version`.

#### **Node.js and npm**

##### **Windows**

1. Download the LTS installer from [nodejs.org](https://nodejs.org/).
2. Run the installer, accepting the default options.
3. Verify installation:
   ```
   node --version
   npm --version
   ```

##### **Linux (Ubuntu)**

1. Install via Terminal:
   ```
   sudo apt update
   sudo apt install nodejs npm
   ```
2. Verify installation as above.

##### **macOS**

1. Download the LTS installer from [nodejs.org](https://nodejs.org/).
2. Run the installer and follow the prompts.
3. Verify installation as above.

#### **Netlify Account (Optional)**

1. Go to [netlify.com](https://www.netlify.com/).
2. Click **"Sign Up"** and create a free account.
3. You can sign up using your GitHub account (recommended) or email address.
